intro: Chrysophyllum subnudum, commonly known as the African star apple, is a small evergreen tree native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by edible, star-shaped fruits with a sweet, tropical flavor. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and agricultural contexts within its native habitat.
